reviews.review_msg: Day 275, still hating.

OK prof. Easy class as its a business course designed for ENSC. Class/prof somewhat unpopular due to lack of resources for studying for midterms. On paper its supposed to be practical (how to run eng business) but in the end no one learns anything. Free 5% from optional dragons den. Relatively easy class overall (esp. pop quizzes). Class avg B.
Super duper superliciously gei.
Super gei.
I found this class and prof resourceful.
Ryan had a lot of great examples in class. An example I'd use would be a prison for keeping us the entire semester just for those pop quizzes. We did the time, chat and we're finally all free.

pop quizzes are easy 30% but you need to come to class. you cant really study for the tests fr unless its definitions from online reading like theyall right but you need to choose the best answer type sh. i mean this with no offense but class was kinda doodoo and i learned nothing from taking this except coming in just for the pop quizzes and tests
Thanks for wasting my time Ryan.
giving them a packet yo

u cant study for this class and theres no point taking notes. you just sit there, listen, and know the definitions and what he's talking about because the tests this year and onwards are probably cooked because of them trying to counter ai. mandatory attendance because of the pop quizzes but the classes are short which is good. do dragons den for 5

For what he's trying to teach, I don't think he's that bad. I do feel this class is a waste of time though. A major difference from this year to the previous year is the difficulty. It is no longer a GPA booster as what the 2024 reviews might suggest. Studying isn't necessary. Just have a good cheatsheet and you can get by without much effort.

Mom: we have Elon Musk at home
Elon Musk at home (but it's a Temu version):
SFU needs to audit this course. Ryan and ENSC 410 is a complete joke.
i dont understand why the quizzes and tests had multiple correct answers just make us choose multiple answers with no debate. glad im through this restarted nightmare.

In my final year and I can't take another lecture from this guy. I'm a straight A's student, love school to death and I just hate coming to this class with a passion. I'm learning nothing EVERY.SINGLE.CLASS. Only talks about his beloved Elon and his company. The website we have to read is so surface level I want to tie a rope around my neck.

It looks like Ryan paid for some google SEO to bury his rate my professor ratings in the search results. I'll always remember how much he loved talking about Elon Musk. He also invited some random banker who gave terrible investing advice. Ryan was basically shilling for the banker. I don't know why SFU allows people like this to teach a course.
I mean I got a good grade so I can't complain but this course was a waste of time.
Really vague test questions that he will let you "debate", but only if he likes you enough. There was no point studying for the final since most of the questions were subjective.
One of the most incompetent profs at SFU.
Some of these reviews are a bit harsh but overall Ryan did a poor job teaching this course.
I thought this was going to be an interesting course but it ended up being a waste of time :(
The lectures are useless just find the discord with all the answers to the tests.
Ignore everything this guy says. He thinks Kevin O'Leary is a good business man and can't stop promoting his own company. One of the guest lecturers he invited literally ghosted him :D

Ryan's class is focused on practical knowledge about business and how to be successful at what you do. Personally I found the material very useful and I always felt engaged during his lectures. Listen well in class and you should be able to figure out most of the exam questions. Make sure to particpate in dragons den, you will need the 5%.
All of Ryan's tests were a complete joke. I ended up getting the best grade in the final without studying at all.
This class is just one very long unskippable ad

This prof let half of the class take a multiple choice test twice because his TAs messed up the submission time. Same questions and he even allowed you to change your answer the second time after already submitting the first time. I didn't get to have this chance since I already submitted before the TAs realized that the submission time was wrong.
This is my last semester at SFU and this course has been by far the most useless course I have taken.

Very easy class but it's a waste of time. The teacher just says random things he finds interesting and there is no real content. Even the website where the class readings comes from is so outdated that it keeps mentioning how great the internet is, as if it was invented a few years ago....
Just found out that there is an entire group chat with answers for the quiz and midterms. This prof doesn't care at all if people cheat in his class.
This guy loves talking about himself. Really useless advice, but everyone has to go to class because of his weird attendance system.

The most "practical" faculty member teaching the most unique class in ENSC. This is a business and entrepreneurial class with heavy inspirations drawn from his personal experiences of which he has plenty. Keeps people engaged in class with pop questions, and invites many guest speaks for a wide range of perspectives on many business topics.

Ryan is an awesome professor that uses many real word examples. He also brings in many guest lecturers that have valuable real world experience. This course is great for introducing business for engineers. However, the grading is can be very unpredictable -- the exam questions can sometimes be contradicting and frustrating.

He knows how to use technology and is antifragile (in the face of covid). I wish he provided lecture notes, It would have made my life a lot easier, as I have trouble multitasking. At least he is happy to help, even when the question is beyond the scope of the course.

Ryan seems like he wants you to learn and succeed, but spends most of his lectures advertising his own company. Tests are awful, questions are subjective and vague. It's very obvious that he puts almost no time into this course, as he literally interrupted the class every 10 minutes to make a correction on the midterm. Doesn't post lecture notes.

Ryan has been a great professor throughout the pandemic. Was the first of my profs to setup online lectures and quizzes. Makes sure you understand the underlying material. Really wants the class to succeed, lets you debate your answers for additional marks after exams are finished as long as you provide a good reason. Great prof.

She seems determined to make an easy course into something she thinks is more beneficial without putting in any effort. Only performs 1/3 of lectures while leaving the rest to the TA's and spends her lecture time talking about her accomplishments instead of course material. She was so bad that one of the TA's openly showed a disliking of her.

She cannot teach and force all staff to TAS. She force us to come to his lecture and she only shows off how good her company is. EXAM includes questions from guest lecture without any materials posted!!!!! They are very unfair and hard!
The only thing in ENSC 410 she did is to introduce how good her company is

Laziest professor I have encountered at SFU. The only reason she comes to class is to talk about herself, otherwise she relies on the TAs to on average teach twice per week. The TAs do all the heavy lifting. She also managed to turn an easy 3 credit hour course into a time consuming mess. How is she allowed to teach at SFU? I would give her a 0/5.

This professor is great and fun but he made tricks on the tests or exams, I personally don't like him because of this. The ENSC 410 is extremely but I feel like this prof doesn't want everyone get A+ on it.
